Sorry, there are no completed fields present and \"Use current location\" was not selected. Provider searches require either a zip code or a click on \"Use current Location.\"
Would you like to save this zip code to your app settings? This allows you to conduct this search later and to set the nearest provider as a preferred provider.

If set along with Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_NEW_DOCUMENT then the task being launched will not be presented to the user but will instead be only available through the recents task list. In addition, the new task wil be affiliated with the launching activity\'s task. Affiliated tasks are grouped together in the recents task list.

Where would you like your Ceremony?

Outdoor Location

Estimated Cost: $0 - $500

Do you feel most at peace outside? Have life\'s best moments occurred with the sun in your face and the wind at your back? If so, you might consider holding your funeral or cremation service outdoors. Friends, family and loved ones will find solace knowing Mother Nature is by your side.

Funeral Home

Estimated Cost: $295 - $595

Funeral homes can be subdued and elegant, with an atmosphere of respect and dignity -- qualities you may be looking for when it comes to selecting a venue for your service. Additionally, funeral directors are helpful, knowledgeable, professional and willing to spend time with you today to ensure your wishes tomorrow. Your personalized funeral service will be carried out with precision and compassion, and may be held before or after burial or cremation.

Personal Residence

Estimated Cost: $0 - $500

Perhaps it\'s where you spent summers with your grandparents, or the cabin in the woods where you escaped on weekends. Maybe it\'s your childhood home, or the home where you raised your own children. Wherever your fondest, most cherished memories take you is where friends and family can honor you. A ceremony at home can be a wonderful, meaningful experience for all of your loved ones.

Religious Facility

Estimated Cost: $0 - $500

Many people consider their church, synagogue or temple a second home, making it a meaningful and sentimental option for a funeral ceremony. Take solace in the knowledge that you and your loved ones will be tended to in a familiar, warm and cherished environment.

Restaurant

Estimated Cost: $0 - $500

Friends sitting around a table. Family side-by-side at a high-top counter. Loved ones gathering in the foyer, anticipating the best seat in the house. If this image appeals to you, you might consider arranging your reception or at one of your favorite restaurants. Breaking bread in your honor is a wonderful way for friends and family to bond as healing begins.

Cemetery

Estimated Cost: $500 - $1,500

Family and friends often assemble at the side of the grave to witness their loved one\'s interment. Some people prefer a cemetery graveside ceremony to be a private, quiet event, while others love the idea of a large group gathering to say their goodbyes. Cemetery staff are compassionate and kind, and can help you pre-plan a graveside service that is meaningful to you and your loved ones.

Island Paradise

Estimated Cost: $0 - $500

On the beach, beneath a palm tree, beside a seaside cove? These are just a few options for the perfect island farewell. The great outdoors as a ceremony venue for your celebration of life doesn\'t have to be limited to sandy beaches. Consider a boat, pier, the deck of a beach home, the patio of a tiki bar, the yard of a bamboo hut. The location creates atmosphere, while your personal touches of food, drink and décor set the mood.

Cemetery Chapel

Estimated Cost: $0 - $500

The simplicity of a cemetery chapel is, by its very nature, elegant and soothing. However, the artist in you can add personal touches to make it uniquely yours. Plan ahead by visiting clergy or staff at the chapel of your choice to inquire about adding your own flair to the chapel. Perhaps you would like to display your own artwork, photography or sculptures. Or, choose a chapel that is infused with art that already appeals to you. Stained glass windows, inspirational architecture or shaped landscaping. The possibilities are limited only by your imagination.

Where would you like your Visitation?

Outdoor Location

Estimated Cost: $0 - $500

Do you feel most at peace outside? Have life\'s best moments occurred with the sun in your face and the wind at your back? If so, you might consider holding your funeral or cremation service outdoors. Friends, family and loved ones will find solace knowing Mother Nature is by your side.

Funeral Home

Estimated Cost:
$295 - $595

Funeral homes can be subdued and elegant, with an atmosphere of respect and dignity -- qualities you may be looking for when it comes to selecting a venue for your service. Additionally, funeral directors are helpful, knowledgeable, professional and willing to spend time with you today to ensure your wishes tomorrow. Your personalized funeral service will be carried out with precision and compassion, and may be held before or after burial or cremation.

Personal Residence

Estimated Cost:
$0 - $500

Perhaps it\'s where you spent summers with your grandparents, or the cabin in the woods where you escaped on weekends. Maybe it\'s your childhood home, or the home where you raised your own children. Wherever your fondest, most cherished memories take you is where friends and family can honor you. A ceremony at home can be a wonderful, meaningful experience for all of your loved ones.

Many people consider their church, synagogue or temple a second home, making it a meaningful and sentimental option for a funeral ceremony. Take solace in the knowledge that you and your loved ones will be tended to in a familiar, warm and cherished environment.

Restaurant

Estimated Cost:
$0 - $500

Friends sitting around a table. Family side-by-side at a high-top counter. Loved ones gathering in the foyer, anticipating the best seat in the house. If this image appeals to you, you might consider arranging your reception or at one of your favorite restaurants. Breaking bread in your honor is a wonderful way for friends and family to bond as healing begins.

Where would you like your Reception?

Hotel

Estimated Cost:
$0 - $500

Hotels are a great option when it comes to choosing a venue for your post-ceremony reception. Not only can a hotel accommodate groups both large and small, but there\'s ample parking and professional staff to oversee every last detail. Some hotels provide catering, while others allow you to provide whatever you wish. Visiting a banquet manager today will inspire you to pre-plan a memorable reception for tomorrow.

Funeral Home

Estimated Cost:
$295 - $595

Funeral homes can be subdued and elegant, with an atmosphere of respect and dignity -- qualities you may be looking for when it comes to selecting a venue for your service. Additionally, funeral directors are helpful, knowledgeable, professional and willing to spend time with you today to ensure your wishes tomorrow. Your personalized funeral service will be carried out with precision and compassion, and may be held before or after burial or cremation.

Personal Residence

Estimated Cost:
$0 - $500

Perhaps it\'s where you spent summers with your grandparents, or the cabin in the woods where you escaped on weekends. Maybe it\'s your childhood home, or the home where you raised your own children. Wherever your fondest, most cherished memories take you is where friends and family can honor you. A ceremony at home can be a wonderful, meaningful experience for all of your loved ones.

Religious Facility

Estimated Cost:
$0 - $500

Many people consider their church, synagogue or temple a second home, making it a meaningful and sentimental option for a funeral ceremony. Take solace in the knowledge that you and your loved ones will be tended to in a familiar, warm and cherished environment.

Restaurant

Estimated Cost:
$0 - $500

Friends sitting around a table. Family side-by-side at a high-top counter. Loved ones gathering in the foyer, anticipating the best seat in the house. If this image appeals to you, you might consider arranging your reception or at one of your favorite restaurants. Breaking bread in your honor is a wonderful way for friends and family to bond as healing begins.

Private Location

Estimated Cost:
$0 - $500

If the thought of a public venue seems impersonal to you, you might consider hosting your reception on private property. A location that is special to you can serve as the setting for an intimate, meaningful gathering.

Choose A Resting Place

Single Burial Plot

Estimated Cost:
$2,400 - $5,000

A single burial space is the most common type of plot in a cemetery, and, as the name implies, allows room for one casket. By pre-arranging, you may have the opportunity to choose your plot, which can be personalized with the placement of an individual marker.

Note that some cemeteries may require you to purchase a burial vault or outer burial container (a concrete, metal or wood structure used to support a casket in the ground) at an additional cost, which may range from $900 - $1,600.

Double Cemetery Plot

Estimated Cost:
$5,000 - $8,000

In-ground, double burial, also known as companion burial, can be achieved two ways. In one option, the first casket is placed low, allowing room for a second casket to be placed on top. Side-by-side burial is just as it sounds — two single plots next to each other. In pre-planning cemetery property, spouses can arrange for their companion burial spaces together.

Note that some cemeteries may require you to purchase a burial vault or outer burial container (a concrete, metal or wood structure used to support a casket in the ground) at an additional cost, which may range from $900 - $1,600 each.

Monuments & Markers

Estimated Cost:
$1,000 - $3,500

Whether you choose to be remembered with a beautiful headstone or in a blossoming memorial garden, customize a monument or marker to commemorate the uniqueness of your life.

On Private Property

Estimated Cost:
$0 - $500

If the thought of a cemetery seems impersonal to you, you might consider burial on private property. A location that is special to you can serve as the setting for an intimate, meaningful graveside service. Your funeral director can help you understand the laws and requirements that are applicable in your state.

Companion Mausoleum Space

Estimated Cost:
$7,000 - $12,000

Companion mausoleum spaces accommodate two caskets, which may be side by side, end to end or stacked together. Mausoleums are above-ground structures, usually on cemetery grounds, that consist of several chambers made to house caskets, and they sometimes include prayer space or a chapel. They range from elaborate to warm and intimate — perhaps the perfect atmosphere for companions.

Family Mausoleum

Estimated Cost:
$200,000 - $500,000

Family mausoleums are aboveground structures that accommodate the casketed remains of several people. There may be one large marker, or smaller individual markers. Family mausoleums may be simple or ornate in architecture and can become historical in nature, as several members of the same family can be entombed in the same mausoleum over generations.

Family Estate

Estimated Cost:
$20,000 - $50,000

Many cemeteries offer family estates, which are reserved areas dedicated to specific families and often bordered by a gate, fence or shrubbery. Individual markers may be erected, or one significant marker that lists family members\' names, dates of birth and dates of death. Family estates can be intimate and historical, as several members and generations can be buried in the same area.

Cremation Garden

Estimated Cost:
$200 - $400

Many cemeteries offer cremation gardens, which are a beautiful and unique way for loved ones to honor your memory. Cremated remains become part of the garden in any number of ways, including niches, benches and more. Landscaped with water features, wind chimes, walking paths, flora, benches and more, a cremation garden doesn\'t look anything like a traditional cemetery.

Single Niche

Estimated Cost:
$1,000 - $2,500

Columbaria are above-ground structures designed specifically for the inurnment of cremated remains. Urns are placed in a niche, some of which are fronted with glass, so that the urn and other objects, such as photographs or cherished possessions, can remain on display. You can personalize your niche by choosing the material and wording on a descriptive plaque.

Companion Niche

Estimated Cost:
$2,200 - $3,500

Companion niches are available for those who wish to ensure side by side inurnment with a loved one. In a columbarium, urns are placed in a niche, some of which are fronted with glass, so that the urn and other objects, such as photographs or cherished possessions, can remain on display. You can personalize your niche by choosing the material and wording on a descriptive plaque. Other cremation memorialization options also are available for cremation interment.

Personal Residence

Estimated Cost:
$0 - $500

Perhaps it\'s where you spent summers with your grandparents, or the cabin in the woods where you escaped on weekends. Maybe it\'s your childhood home, or the home where you raised your own children. Wherever your fondest, most cherished memories take you is where friends and family can honor you. A ceremony at home can be a wonderful, meaningful experience for all of your loved ones.

Scattering of Ashes

Estimated Cost:
$100 - $400

From mountain tops to the ocean, the scattering of ashes is appealing to many who are pre-planning a cremation. A scattering service may also be a substitute for, or a continuation of, a memorial service. All states allow scattering of ashes, and some states require permits, particularly in state and national parks. Scattering on private property is prohibited without the permission of the property owner. Check with your funeral director for guidance on laws or regulations governing scattering in your area.

Would you like a Casket or an Urn?

Caskets

Estimated Cost:
$1,500 - $8,000

Our caskets are sourced from the highest-quality material and come in a wide assortment of designs to meet the specific needs of your family.

Urns

Estimated Cost:
$300 - $1,500

Urns can be as unique and distinctive as the life they represent. Choose from a variety of designs and materials, and customize to suit your personal needs.

Aren\'t funeral service providers all the same?
Service, quality and value can vary widely among funeral providers. Pre-planning a funeral allows you to research different providers in advance so you can be comfortable with their services, expertise, facility and ability to accommodate your specific desires. If you fund your pre-planned funeral, you\'ll want to make sure your preneed funds are secure and held in trust or used to purchase an insurance policy from a third-party provider.
Can a funeral be personalized?
Yes. Whether the ceremony is elaborate or simple, today\'s funerals are often individualized to reflect the life lived. You can personalize a funeral service by incorporating music, photos, mementos, decorations, catering and more to reflect the unique accomplishments, passions, hobbies or activities that characterized the life of the decedent.
Can cremated remains be divided?
Yes. You may choose to have cremated remains divided, scattering some and burying the rest. Or you may choose to bury or scatter some of the remains and divide the rest among family members. Small urns called "keepsake" urns are available to hold small portions of cremated remains.
Can cremated remains share the same grave space with a casketed burial?
It really depends on the specific cemetery\'s policy and applicable state law. You may be able to have your cremated remains buried on top of the casket of your spouse, for example, or utilize the space next to him or her. Some cemeteries allow for multiple containers of cremated remains to be interred in a single grave space for an additional charge.
Can we still have a funeral service if cremation is chosen?
Absolutely. Regardless of whether you choose burial or cremation, a funeral or memorial service is a celebration of the life that has been lived. It offers family and friends the opportunity to pay tribute to their loved one as well as an opportunity to grieve in a supportive environment. You can have a ceremony with the urn present if the cremation has already taken place, or you can have a traditional funeral with visitation and viewing before the body is cremated if you desire.
Do I have to prepay for my preplanned funeral?
No. There is great benefit in pre-planning your funeral, even if you do not pay for it in advance, which is called "pre-funding." When you pre-plan, you can still make your wishes known to your loved ones, alleviating them from the burden of making tough decisions when the time comes. However, if you pay for ("pre-fund") your pre-planned funeral in advance, you can lock in today\'s prices for services and merchandise which may be more expensive in the future.
